analysis.summary: Niagara Falls Water Board seeks a qualified engineering consultant to perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) services in specified LaSalle area sewersheds, including I&I source identification, corrective action planning, and post-construction monitoring, with optional pricing for Phases 2 and 3. The work must comply with NYSDEC requirements, the Engineering Planning Grant (EPG) conditions, and mandatory MWBE/SDVOB participation and reporting.

requirements.description: Attend a mandatory pre-proposal information session at the Wastewater Treatment Plant on November 29, 2022 at noon.
Submit sealed proposal by Monday, December 5, 2022 by 2:00 p.m. to the location and contact specified.
Direct all written questions to the authorized Water Board contact by the stated deadline and use email with appropriate subject line.
Email the authorized contact to be placed on the distribution list in order to receive RFP updates and Q&A promptly.

Provide professional engineering services to perform a sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) for Phase 1, including identification of I&I sources and preparation of a corrective action plan, with options for Phases 2 and 3.

Comply with terms and conditions applicable to the Wastewater Infrastructure Engineering Planning Grant (EPG) and NYSDEC requirements, including the Engineering Report Outline for NYS Wastewater Infrastructure Projects dated October 1, 2022.
Perform Phase 1 SSES tasks in the specified sewersheds (91st & Luick; 81st & Frontier 1) covering 4.8 miles of sanitary main pipe.
Provide option prices, schedules, and scopes for Phase 2 and Phase 3 SSES work as described, recognizing NFWB may award these later.

Task 1 – Assign a Project Manager as primary contact; review existing data and records including Order on Consent and NYSDEC correspondence; gain familiarity with Phase 1 sewershed and I&I history; meet with NFWB staff; provide ongoing professional advice and participate in meetings with NFWB and NYSDEC.

Task 2 – Conduct smoke testing: provide all staff, equipment, materials; notify residents 2–4 days in advance with door hangers; assist in press release and notices to police and fire; perform testing under appropriate weather; document and photograph defects.

Task 3 – Perform flow isolation and measurement (night-time weiring): review prior flow data; select appropriate weir locations in consultation with NFWB; ensure sufficient measurements for complete I&I analysis; provide staff, equipment, traffic control, and confined space entry capabilities; notify residents; analyze data including infiltration in gallons/day/linear foot.

Task 4 – Review and analyze NFWB CCTV and manhole inspection reports; summarize findings; identify and request additional data collection as needed; coordinate with NFWB regarding repairs completed since inspections; use recorded CCTV footage and additional imaging as required.

Task 5 – Conduct Outfall/SSO condition assessment for the two Phase 1 outfalls identified in Appendix D, including review of existing information, site visits, development of a work plan (potentially including flow meters, rain gauges, dye testing, confined space entry, CCTV coordination), execution of authorized actions, and documentation in GIS-compatible format with recommendations.

Task 6 – Plan for focused SSES activities (dye testing, house inspections, additional CCTV by NFWB) in areas identified as I&I sources; include a $10,000 contingency amount in the proposal budget for this or other unforeseen necessary work, expendable only with NFWB approval.

Task 7 – Prepare an SSES report for Phase 1 satisfactory to NYSDEC, identifying I&I sources and a corrective action plan with cost-effectiveness analysis, budgetary costs, and implementation timelines; ensure report is completed early enough in 2023 to allow construction in 2023–early 2024; report must be prepared, stamped, and dated by a NYS licensed Professional Engineer and conform to the NYS Engineering Report Outline.

Task 8 – Conduct post-construction monitoring of Phase 1 improvements (assumed constructed in 2023) in 2024, including I&I assessment of pre- and post-construction flows and rainfall; prepare a Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC documenting I&I reductions and most effective techniques.

Proposals must include, at a minimum: situation understanding; understanding of applicable regulations and standards; project approach, scope, and project organization; demonstrated experience on similar projects; experience and qualifications of subconsultants/contractors; specific experience of key project professionals; and schedule, effort, and budget breakdown (bar chart schedule, task/hour estimate matrix, not-to-exceed fee, and $10,000 contingency for Task 6).
For Option 1 (Phase 2), provide schedule and fees to perform all applicable Phase 1 tasks except Task 5 for the Phase 2 sewersheds (81st & Frontier 2; 80th & Lindbergh).
For Option 2 (Phase 3), provide schedule and fees to perform all applicable Phase 1 tasks for the Phase 3 sewershed (Mang & 88th), including one Outfall/SSO.

Complete all forms in Appendix E (standard terms, conditions, and requirements) and return them with the proposal, including Acknowledgement of Addenda, Certificate of Non-Collusion, Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement, EEO Policy Statement and Agreement, Statement on Sexual Harassment, and RFP Acknowledgement and Certification.

Accept that standard terms, conditions, and requirements in Appendix E will form part of any resulting contract unless otherwise agreed in writing; list any exceptions in a separate "Exceptions" attachment or be deemed to consent to all terms.

Provide a statement of qualifications including business structure, licensing, years in business, similar project experience with references, locations, key personnel descriptions, aliases used in past 10 years, subsidiaries/parents, debarment/default/liquidated damages history, bankruptcy and legal actions history, conflict of interest disclosures, and details of subcontractors performing more than 10% of the work.
Acknowledge that proposals are firm and irrevocable for 90 days from the submission deadline, unless extended by addendum.
Be prepared to participate in oral presentations or interviews with NFWB staff and/or Board if invited, at proposer’s own cost.

Comply with communication restrictions under NYS Lobbying Law (State Finance Law §§139-j and 139-k), limiting contacts during the Restricted Period to the designated contact and providing required certifications and disclosures (Appendix E Form No. 3).

Submit proposal package: one clearly marked original and six copies, plus one electronic copy on CD or USB (preferably PDF generated from source files); ensure signed appendices are included in paper original; use a sealed outer envelope addressed to the Water Board contact, clearly marked with proposer’s name, address, RFP number, and title; ensure timely delivery.
Maintain adequate and competent personnel with necessary licensing, education, training, and experience; ensure compliance with NFWB credentialing, security, safety, and other protocols.

Procure and maintain required insurance coverage (Workers’ Compensation, Disability, Employer’s Liability, Commercial General Liability, Automobile Liability, Umbrella/Excess Liability, and Professional Liability) with specified limits; name NFWB, Niagara Falls Public Water Authority, and City of Niagara Falls as additional insureds where required; provide certificates before work begins.

Agree to indemnify and hold harmless NFWB, its Directors, Officers, and Employees to the full extent permissible by NY law for losses arising from contractor actions or inactions, and waive rights against NFWB for damages covered by required insurance.

Develop and, if requested, submit a Safety Program and Site-Specific Health & Safety Plan addressing safety procedures, PPE, OSHA training compliance, and monitoring; ensure all operations comply with OSHA and relevant health and safety regulations.
Operate as an independent contractor; identify all subcontractors in the proposal; accept that NFWB may reject proposed subcontractors and that proposer remains responsible for entire contract.

Maintain complete and accurate records directly pertinent to contract performance for at least six years beyond the calendar year of creation; allow access for inspection and audit by authorized parties.
Comply with NYS Information Security Breach and Notification laws (GBL §§899-aa, 899-bb; State Technology Law §208) for any work involving data security or breaches.
Pay prevailing wages as required by law and, if applicable, submit quarterly Workforce Employment Utilization Reports reflecting workforce and salaries.

Provide complete and accurate monthly invoices with required documentation; comply with MWBE/SDVOB utilization and reporting requirements as a condition for payment; accept 60-day payment terms from NFWB for undisputed invoices.
Acknowledge NFWB’s exemption from sales tax and exclude such taxes from pricing.

Provide and agree to an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy Statement consistent with Appendix E Form No. 4, and commit to non-discrimination and affirmative action obligations, including flow-down to subcontractors.
Certify implementation of a written sexual harassment prevention policy and annual training meeting NY Labor Law §201-g; submit Statement on Sexual Harassment (Appendix E Form No. 5).
Certify compliance with Iran Divestment Act (not on Prohibited Entities List) and agree not to use subcontractors on that list.
Certify compliance with international boycott prohibition (Export Administration Act) and MacBride Fair Employment Principles for operations in Northern Ireland, if applicable.
Certify compliance with prohibition on purchase of tropical hardwoods unless exempt; ensure subcontractors also comply and document any exemptions.
Disclose and avoid conflicts of interest; certify no improper payments or benefits to NFWB officials; agree that no funds will be used for political or religious activities.
Submit a signed Certificate of Non-Collusion (Appendix E Form No. 2) affirming independent pricing and no collusive behavior.

Acknowledge NFWB’s right to terminate the contract for cause, convenience, or violation of Lobbying Law; accept governing law and venue in NY; and consent to service of process by registered/certified mail.

Comply with MWBE and SDVOB participation goals and requirements in Appendix F (Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms): 30% combined MWBE and 6% SDVOB; submit EEO Staffing Plan, Workforce Reports, MWBE and SDVOB Utilization Plans or waiver requests with proposal and prior to contract; provide Monthly MWBE-SDVOB reports with proof of payment; accept potential liquidated damages for willful non-compliance.
Certify that contractor and subcontractors are not debarred under NY Labor Law §220-b or Executive Law §316 and will not contract with debarred entities.
Acknowledge addenda received using Appendix E Form No. 1 or certify that no addenda were received.
Explicitly mark any proposal content claimed as confidential under FOIL, with justification, and structure proposal so confidential sections are separable.

Recognize NFWB’s rights under the RFP (to reject proposals, waive irregularities, award partial scope, accept non-lowest price, etc.) and structure proposal accordingly, presenting best technical and cost terms in initial offer.
Plan for coordination and cooperation with other contractors and third parties on site as needed to ensure service delivery without conflict.

evaluation_criteria.description: Demonstrated understanding of the LaSalle SSO context, Order on Consent, I&I and SSO issues, project objectives, constraints, and regulatory environment. [PAGE TO CITE: 8, 2]
Relevant experience with similar SSES/I&I mitigation projects, NYSDEC/EPG-funded work, staff qualifications, and organizational capability to deliver all tasks and phases. [PAGE TO CITE: 8, 15]
Inclusion of all required sections, forms, technical tasks, schedules, budgets, and options for Phases 2 and 3, as well as adherence to submission instructions. [PAGE TO CITE: 8, 6, 18]
Overall cost competitiveness, clarity of task/hour estimates, not-to-exceed fee, and inclusion of required contingency and options. [PAGE TO CITE: 8, 6]

submission_requirements.format: Sealed hardcopy package with one original and six copies plus one electronic copy on CD/USB (PDF preferred), delivered to NFWB; include completed Appendix E forms and clearly marked outer envelope with proposer information and RFP number/title.

Project approach, scope, and project organization
Specific experience of key project professionals
Effort & budget breakdown (task/hour estimate matrix, not-to-exceed fee)
Options for Phase 2 and Phase 3 (schedules and fees)
Completed Appendix E forms including addenda acknowledgment, non-collusion, lobbying law disclosure, EEO policy, sexual harassment statement, and RFP acknowledgement/certification
MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or waiver requests

key_differentiators: Demonstrated deep understanding of the LaSalle SSO Order on Consent history, NYSDEC’s shift to R-value methodology, and sewershed-specific I&I prioritization, with a tailored approach rather than generic SSES methods. [PAGE TO CITE: 2, 3]

A clear, integrated technical approach that not only meets but enhances the minimum tasks (e.g., advanced data analytics for flow monitoring, robust GIS integration, and well-justified weir placement strategies) to produce actionable, cost-effective I&I reduction plans. [PAGE TO CITE: 3, 4, 5]

Strong track record delivering similar SSES/I&I and NYSDEC- or EFC-funded wastewater projects, including experience preparing Engineering Reports that conform to the October 1, 2022 outline and successfully navigating NYSDEC review. [PAGE TO CITE: 2, 5, 36-43]

A realistic yet aggressive schedule that aligns SSES completion, NYSDEC review, design, and construction to enable post-construction monitoring by June 2024, showing clear critical path awareness and risk mitigation. [PAGE TO CITE: 5, 7]

Robust project management and communication plan including proactive coordination with NFWB staff, NYSDEC, and residents (e.g., thoughtful public notification strategies for smoke testing and weiring) to minimize disruption and build stakeholder confidence. [PAGE TO CITE: 3, 4]

Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed MWBE (30%) and SDVOB (6%) participation goals with credible, named partners and a clear plan for compliance reporting, minimizing NFWB’s risk around state funding requirements. [PAGE TO CITE: 7, 8, 36-43]
Comprehensive health and safety program for confined space entry, night work, and field activities, with site-specific plans that reduce NFWB’s operational risk. [PAGE TO CITE: 3, 4, 20]

Transparent, well-structured cost proposal with clear task/hour breakdowns, linkage to deliverables, and value-added options for Phases 2 and 3 that show economies of scale and long-term partnership potential. [PAGE TO CITE: 6, 8]
